intro: Anadenia roei, commonly known as the pink fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range from pink to white. The plant produces bulbous roots and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Anadenia roei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique floral display.
